DOCNAME: CASE OF SOCIEDADE DE CONSTRUCOES MARTINS AND VIEIRA, LDA v. PORTUGAL
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Criminal proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy);Respondent State to take measures of a general character (Article 46-2 - General measures)
JUDGES: Dmitry Dedov;Elisabeth Steiner;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant company is a NORP limited liability company . The second and third applicants are the applicant company ’s managing partners ( see PERSON for details ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( ORG ) started an investigation into the applicant company ’s fiscal activity DATE .
CARDINAL . Following the investigation , CARDINAL sets of fiscal criminal proceedings were instituted before the Porto and ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were made defendants ( arguidos ) in both sets of proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor brought charges ( acusação ) against the applicant company and third applicant in FAC for tax fraud in relation to activities dating back to DATE , when the applicant company was registered in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the trial began . The hearing was adjourned to DATE and then to DATE due to the absence of some of the defence witnesses .
CARDINAL . On DATE of the hearing , the applicant company ’s and third applicant ’s representative resigned . The hearing was adjourned pending his replacement .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant company and third applicant gave power of attorney to the same lawyer .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants informed ORG that they had sought a judicial review before ORG of a tax adjustment applied to them regarding the applicant company ’s fiscal activity DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG suspended the fiscal criminal proceedings in accordance with LAW das Infracções Fiscais não Aduaneiras – “ RJIFNA ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants applied to ORG ( ORG ) for an order to have the criminal proceedings expedited ( pedido de aceleração processual ) .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed their application on the grounds that the delay in the proceedings , under the law , was attributable to ORG rather than ORG . The ORG pointed out that the applicants should have therefore lodged their expedition application with ORG .
CARDINAL . The proceedings are still pending before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor of ORG brought charges against the CARDINAL applicants for tax fraud and abuse ( fraude fiscal e abuso de confiança fiscal ) in relation to activities that had taken place DATE , when the applicant company was registered in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants contested the proceedings . On DATE they applied for them to be suspended until a final decision was adopted in relation to the judicial review pending before FAC ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered that the proceedings be suspended in accordance with LAW RJIFNA and requested information from FAC regarding the progress of the judicial review .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed ORG that the proceedings brought by the applicants against the tax adjustment were still pending .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG suspended the proceedings until a final decision was adopted by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed ORG that the judicial review was still pending .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants applied to ORG to have the proceedings expedited .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed their application on the grounds that the fiscal criminal proceedings had been suspended in accordance with the law . It also considered that their request should have been made to ORG .
CARDINAL . The proceedings are still pending before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the applicants instituted proceedings in tort ( ação de responsabilidade civil extracontratual ) against the ORG in the PERSON and Braga Administrative and ORG ( case ORG . ORG and CARDINAL respectively ) , claiming damages for the excessive length of the above - mentioned criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . According to the latest information received by ORG on DATE , the proceedings are still pending .
